data.message: Can we get our time line in chronological order

replies.message: Hi Christopher. To select the Most Recent News Feed please click the More button (three lines on the bottom right), scroll down to the Feeds section and select Most Recent. Hope that helps! -Sarah

SO WHEN IS FACEBOOK GOING TO CONTACT ME ABOUT HAVING MY NAME CHANGED BACK TO WHAT IT IS SUPPOSED TO BE? MY NAME IS NOT JAMES JOHNSON AND I WANT IT CHANGED BACK TO WHAT IT REALLY IS. WHAT PROOF DID YOU HAVE THAT MY NAME WAS NOT REAL TO MAKE ME CHANGE IT IN THE FIRST PLACE???? A RESPONSE WOULD BE GREAT!!!
It doesn't stay like that. It was fine before y'all messed it up.

We're sorry you feel that way, Alisha. We've invested a lot to understand how News Feed can show the most engaging content to the majority of people. Top Stories is the result of our findings, which is why it is the default. We know that some people prefer the Most Recent view, so we've kept this option available. If you have specific thoughts you want to share, please let us know here: http://on.fb.me/1rmVirO. -Jenny
Can y'all answer the question I posted?
Please respond to it, but God I've got that, but Hacker Facebook Post   ا
@ALISHA PARKER - FB answered your question. If you don't understand their response let them know but no need to be rude. Thank you

No, they really didn't answer her question.  We select most recent but it won't stay that way.  If we wanted top stories we would leave it.  When we set it to most recent we don't want it to default back.  Is it really that hard?
Yea, come on Facebook. If it aint broke, don't fix it.
Dot Sherwood, I posted an entirely different question than the one in this set if comments. I've posted the same question numerous times, but nobody will answer me. And I wasn't rude.
We the people want most recent!! On Groups this is a major problem as well. Why not create a... Hottest topic drop down or link?
